parts:
You are extracting a UBX protocol message definition from u-blox PDF manual pages.

TARGET MESSAGE: UBX-CFG-PM2
Expected IDs from TOC: class_id=0x06, message_id=0x3b

CRITICAL INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Extract ONLY the message named "UBX-CFG-PM2". Ignore any other messages visible.
2. The payload table shows fields in order. Extract them exactly as shown with correct byte offsets.
3. Verify field sizes match offset differences.

=== DATA TYPES ===

Scalar types (use EXACTLY these values):
- U1, U2, U4, U8 = Unsigned integers (1/2/4/8 bytes)
- I1, I2, I4, I8 = Signed integers - NOTE: "I" is capital letter i, NOT digit 1
- X1, X2, X4, X8 = Bitfields (use for flags, mask, status fields)
- R4, R8 = Floating point (4/8 bytes)
- CH = ASCII character (1 byte)

Array types: Use object format {"array_of": "U1", "count": N}
- Check Type column for "[N]" or "x N" notation
- Verify array size matches offset gap to next field

=== CHARACTER RECOGNITION WARNINGS ===

The PDF uses fonts where these characters look similar:
- "I" (letter i) vs "1" (digit one): Data types are I1, I2, I4 (not 11, 12, 14)
- "O" (letter o) vs "0" (digit zero): Message names like UBX-ODO use letter "O"

=== FIELD EXTRACTION ===

For each field extract:
- name: Exact field name from PDF (preserve camelCase)
- byte_offset: Integer from "Offset" column (0-indexed)
- data_type: UBX type or array object
- description: Field description text
- unit: Physical unit if shown (ms, deg, m/s, etc.)
- scale: If scaling factor shown, include {"raw": "1e-7", "multiplier": 1e-7}
- reserved: Set true for reserved fields
- bitfield: For X-type fields with bit definitions, extract structure

=== ARRAY DETECTION (CRITICAL) ===

Common extraction error: missing arrays. Check carefully:
- Type column shows: "U1[6]", "U1 x 6", "CH[30]" = array
- Offset gaps reveal arrays: offset 4 to 8 with U1 = 4-byte array
- Reserved fields often span multiple bytes

=== BITFIELD DETECTION (CRITICAL) ===

Use X1/X2/X4 (NOT U1/U2/U4) when:
- Field named "flags", "mask", "status", "cfg", "supported", "enabled"
- Description mentions "bitfield" or lists bit meanings
- Sub-table shows bit positions

Extract bitfield structure for ALL X-type fields:
{"bits": [{"name": "bitName", "bit_start": 0, "bit_end": 0, "description": "..."}]}

=== PAYLOAD LENGTH ===

- Fixed: {"fixed": 28}
- Variable: {"variable": {"base": 8, "formula": "8 + N*12", "min": 8}}

=== REPEATED GROUPS (CRITICAL) ===

Many UBX messages contain repeated blocks of fields. Look for:
- "N x ..." or "numXxx x ..." patterns in the payload table
- Fields that repeat based on a count field (e.g., numSvs, numCh)
- Variable-length payloads with repeating structures

Extract repeated groups as:
{"repeated_groups": [{
  "name": "groupName",
  "repetition_type": "count_field",
  "count_field": "numSvs",
  "group_size_bytes": 12,
  "base_offset": 8,
  "fields": [...]
}]}

Common patterns:
- INF messages: Have a "str" repeated group for variable-length text
- NAV-SAT, NAV-ORB: Have satellite blocks repeated per numSvs
- MON-RXBUF: Has pending[] arrays per port

=== MESSAGE TYPE ===

Determine from context:
- "periodic" or "periodic_polled": Output messages sent automatically or on poll
- "input": Messages sent TO the receiver
- "output": Messages sent FROM the receiver  
- "command": One-shot commands
- "get"/"set"/"get_set": Configuration messages
- "poll_request": Poll request (usually empty payload)

=== SPECIAL MESSAGE TYPES ===

**UBX-INF-* (INF-DEBUG, INF-ERROR, INF-NOTICE, INF-WARNING, INF-TEST):**
- These contain a variable-length ASCII string payload
- Extract a single field named "str" with data_type {"array_of": "CH", "count": "variable"}
- Use repeated_groups with repetition_type "fill_remaining" for the string
- Do NOT return empty fields array

**UBX-MGA-* (Multiple GNSS Assistance):**
- Often have MULTIPLE SUB-TYPES on same pages (EPH, ALM, IONO, etc.)
- Each sub-type has different "type" field value and different payload
- Extract ONLY the sub-type matching the message name
- If name includes sub-type (e.g., "UBX-MGA-GPS-EPH"), extract only that

**UBX-LOG-FINDTIME:**
- Has TWO structures: INPUT (request) and OUTPUT (response)
- INPUT: version, type, year, month, day, hour, minute, second, reserved
- OUTPUT: version, type, reserved, entryNumber
- Extract based on message name suffix (-INPUT or -OUTPUT)

**UBX-RXM-RLM:**
- Has SHORT (16 bytes, type=0x01) and LONG (28 bytes, type=0x02) variants
- Extract based on message name suffix (-SHORT or -LONG)

**UBX-RXM-PMREQ:**
- V0 (8 bytes): duration, flags - NO version field
- V1 (16 bytes): version, reserved0[3], duration, flags, wakeupSources
- Extract based on suffix (-V0 or -V1)

=== QUALITY CHECKS ===

Before returning, verify:
- Byte offsets are sequential and non-overlapping
- Field sizes match offset gaps (offset 4 to 8 = 4 bytes)
- Total field sizes match payload length
- All fields from the payload table are included
If any of these appear to fail, you should review your initial extraction and re-extract the message.



=== MESSAGE NAME FORMAT (CRITICAL) ===

The "name" field MUST be EXACTLY "UBX-CFG-PM2" with NO modifications:
- Do NOT add descriptions like "(Poll request)" or "(Version 0)"
- Do NOT add suffixes like "Request" or "Poll"
- Do NOT include any parenthetical text
- Use ONLY the canonical message name: "UBX-CFG-PM2"

=== OUTPUT FORMAT ===

Return a JSON object with this structure:
{
  "name": "UBX-CFG-PM2",
  "class_id": "0xNN",
  "message_id": "0xNN",
  "description": "Short description",
  "message_type": "output",
  "payload": {
    "length": {"fixed": N} or {"variable": {...}},
    "fields": [
      {
        "name": "fieldName",
        "byte_offset": 0,
        "data_type": "U4",
        "description": "...",
        "unit": "ms",
        "scale": {"raw": "1e-7", "multiplier": 1e-7},
        "bitfield": {"bits": [...]}
      }
    ],
    "repeated_groups": [...]
  }
}

Extract the message completely and accurately.

{
  "verdict": "correct",
  "confidence": "high",
  "reasoning": "The extraction of UBX-CFG-PM2 (0x06 0x3b) perfectly matches the provided PDF screenshots and consensus structure. The byte offsets are correctly calculated and sequential (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 22, 24, 44), accounting for the 48-byte total length. Field names, data types (including the 20-byte array for reserved2), units, and bitfield definitions for 'flags' (offset 4) are accurately extracted. The complex description for the version field was also correctly captured.",
  "corrected_structure": null,
  "change_details": null
}

fields.name: version
fields.description: Message version (0x02 for this version). Note: the message version number is the same as for protocol versions 18 up to 22; select correct message version based on the protocol version supported by your firmware.

fields.name: maxStartupStateDur
fields.description: Maximum time to spend in Acquisition state. If 0: bound disabled.

bits.name: optTarget
bits.description:
Optimization target (not supported for protocol versions 32.00 and later)
000 performance (default)
001 power save
010 reserved
011 reserved
100 reserved
101 reserved
110 reserved
111 reserved

bits.name: extintWake
bits.description:
EXTINT pin control
0 disabled
1 enabled, keep receiver awake as long as selected EXTINT pin is 'high'

bits.name: extintBackup
bits.description:
EXTINT pin control
0 disabled
1 enabled, force receiver into BACKUP mode when selected EXTINT pin is 'low'

bits.name: extintInactive
bits.description:
EXTINT pin control
0 disabled
1 enabled, force backup in case EXTINT pin is inactive for time longer than extintincactivityMs

bits.name: limitPeakCurr
bits.description:
Limit peak current
00 disabled
01 enabled, peak current is limited
10 reserved
11 reserved

bits.name: waitTimeFix
bits.description:
Wait for Timefix
0 wait for normal fix OK before starting on time
1 wait for time fix OK before starting on time

bits.name: updateRTC
bits.description:
Update real time clock
0 do not wake up to update RTC. RTC is updated during normal on-time.
1 update RTC. The receiver adds extra wake-up cycles to update the RTC. (not supported for protocol versions 23.00 to 23.01, and 32.00 and later)

bits.name: updateEPH
bits.description:
Update ephemeris
0 do not wake up to update Ephemeris data
1 update Ephemeris. The receiver adds extra wake-up cycles to update the Ephemeris data.

bits.name: doNotEnterOff
bits.description:
Behavior of receiver in case of no fix
0 receiver enters (Inactive) Awaiting next search state
1 receiver does not enter (Inactive) Awaiting next search state but keeps trying to acquire a fix instead

bits.name: mode
bits.description:
Mode of operation
00 ON/OFF operation
01 cyclic tracking operation
10 reserved
11 reserved

fields.name: updatePeriod
fields.description: Position update period. If set to 0, the receiver will never retry a fix and it will wait for external events (only affects the update period in ON/OFF operation for protocol versions 32.00 and later).

fields.name: searchPeriod
fields.description: Acquisition retry period if previously failed. If set to 0, the receiver will never retry a startup.

fields.name: gridOffset
fields.description: Grid offset relative to GPS start of week

fields.name: onTime
fields.description: Time to stay in Tracking state

fields.name: extintInactivityMs
fields.description: inactivity time out on EXTINT pin if enabled

review.reasoning: The extraction of UBX-CFG-PM2 (0x06 0x3b) perfectly matches the provided PDF screenshots and consensus structure. The byte offsets are correctly calculated and sequential (0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 8, 12, 16, 20, 22, 24, 44), accounting for the 48-byte total length. Field names, data types (including the 20-byte array for reserved2), units, and bitfield definitions for 'flags' (offset 4) are accurately extracted. The complex description for the version field was also correctly captured.
